name: Astral Tower and Residences at The Star

reviews.text: we booked an apartment...............wow complete with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, Lounge come dinning room, full kitchen and washer / tumble dryer..............great value
reviews.title: Great Apartment

reviews.text: Séan F
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — The View from the Deluxe Room!

reviews.text: Stayed seven nights from New years day, we picked Star City as it was close to Darling Harbour. The downside first, they had no apartments available and we were placed in a Deluxe Room, very Nice but the Sheraton in Noosa was better. Considering the money we were paying the room could have been nicer and the view was not good (so beware).
reviews.title: loved this hotel

likes.liked: — cleanliness, spaciousness and views from both balconies especially at night

reviews.title: A Brilliant Hotel
reviews.text: The good points, we ate at Fortunes which was Breakfast Buffet this was in with the price of the Room, Buffet was excellent with a lot of choice, although senior staff attempted to try and rush you if it was close to closing (10.30am). We also ate at Pyrmonts this is a excellant location and wonderful food I highly recommend the Seafood platter for two . We also used Astral Bar on the roof, which is a excellant way to start or end your evening, inside or out you will have a gorgeous view of Darling Harbour,CBD and the Bridge.

reviews.title: Large 4* Apartment
reviews.text: We visited the Casino (not my scene) but for those who enjoy a flutter there cannot be better in Oz and we enjoyed having a drink in one of the bars and just people watched, the casino seemed busy 24/7.

Star City Hotel is GREAT!! Excellent location, great bars and pubs and resurants. Close walk to Darling Harbour. Great experience. Oh and dont forget the CASINO..When you stay in Sydney, you gotta check it out.
reviews.title: FUN

reviews.text: We stayed at Star City for six nights, having been recommended the aparttments by some friends. It's a huge entertainment complex close to Darling Harbour. We arrived very early (around 6am in the morning) but despite this unearthly hour the reception desk were very helpful and checked us into our apartment straightaway. Even if this hadn't been possible we could have used the pool and leisure complex to get freshened up after our long flight.
reviews.title: Big and Brash - But we loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying at the apartments with our three daughters, aged 8, 14 and 16 and there was loads of space. We had two bedrooms and two bathrooms with a bed settee in the living area. The kitchen was really really well equipped with everything we could possibly have needed - and all the utensils and cooker, hob, fridge freezer etc looked brand new.
reviews.title: Top spot to stay

likes.disliked: — a little tired in the coridoos - thats it..

reviews.text: The swimming pool was a slight disappointment in that it was quite small and very cold! However, we were so busy that we didn't need to use it more than once anyway!
reviews.title: More than just a hotel!

likes.liked: — The whole experience of such a fantastic hotel
likes.disliked: — Our room didn't really have a

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have been more pleased with the apartment itself - although it wasn't especially cheap. I think we paid around £1250 for 6 nights. Although it felt slightly out on a limb - transport links to the hotel were fantastic. It was a five minute walk to Darling harbour - where there are scores of restaurants, bars, shops and attractions and of course ferries to Circular Quay...
reviews.title: Not at all bad

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom apartments in March this year. We arrived early so we had to hang around for a while but they did call my internatioal mobile when the room was ready and we could use the pool and spa whilst we waited.
reviews.title: Excellent apartments
loved the hotel
reviews.text: The room was excellent. We did not have the view over the harbor but what we had was fine. The room was very clean and every day the maid but the dirty stuff in the dishwasher and turned it on!

reviews.title: Outstanding location
reviews.text: Location was second to non with 1 5 minute stroll to Darling Harbor with its attractions, resturants and the like. There is a Coles less than 5 minutes walk that is open late. The small shop at the hotel is expensive buy has the basics. The massive spa was good and we sat in there overlooking the bridge at night.
Can't say anthing about the casino as we did not go (had young kids).
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would go back if we went back to Sydney.
reviews.title: Only okay, too much waiting!

reviews.text: It is what it is i.e. a Casino Hotel! That said we stayed in a three bedroom apartment on the ninth floor (952) that had fantastic views of Darling Harbour and the Sydney Harbour Bridge - all which looked spectular - especially at night.
reviews.title: Great venue

likes.liked: — Location and value for money and views

reviews.text: Darling Harbour with its bars and restaurants is only minutes away. Yoy can walk to Circular Quay via Market Street and George Street in about 30 minutes or alternatively you can catch a ferry (with five stops) from Darling Quay.
reviews.title: Great service & rooms

likes.liked: — The staff at the Fortunes Bistro was excellent

reviews.text: Our room had all the facilities to support our stay. The convenience store open 247 is good but a little pricey. The food mall ranges from a Subway to an Italian style bistro and there is also fast food and more in the casino.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, loved that things were opened 24 hours

likes.disliked: — drunk people hanging around after midnight

reviews.text: We are not casino types but it is well worth going if only people watch and enter the free daily draw ... you need to register for a casino card (which is free). My wife won a $10 voucher which she converted to $100 with a lucky win on the roulette table. Our one and only gamble!
reviews.title: An extensively huge property...

likes.liked: — The scenic view of Darling Harbour fom the room
likes.disliked: — Impersonal service by the front desk at times.

reviews.text: Also it is worth going to Chinatown via Darling Harbour Gardens. It takes about 20 mins to walk there and the food is cheap compared to the harbourside restaurants.
reviews.title: Views to die for

likes.disliked: — Bit confusing when trying to first find reception

description: Casino Hotel Complex situated 1 km across Darling Harbour from the city.
